text: Andrei Gennadyevich Karlov (; 4 February 1954 – 19 December 2016) was a Russian diplomat. He served as the Russian Ambassador to Turkey from 12 July 2013 until his assassination. He also served as Russia's ambassador to North Korea from 9 July 2001 to 20 December 2006. He was born in Moscow. == Death == Karlov was shot and killed on 19 December 2016 in Ankara, Turkey. He was 62 years old. His killer, 22-year-old Mevlüt Mert Altıntaş, was killed by security forces after shooting the ambassador.Russian ambassador to Turkey shot dead by police officer in Ankara gallery ==References== Category:1954 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Ambassadors of Russia Category:Assassinated Russian people Category:Murders by firearm
title: Andrei Karlov
